title: Police identify suspected burglar, 14, found dead in Austin home
content:
AUSTIN - Police have identified the suspected burglar who was found dead in an East Austin home Monday night as 14-year-old Axel Kenneth Loera.
The Austin Police Department said officers originally responded to a reported burglary in progress at a residence located at 6000 Perlita Drive near Sendero Hills shortly after 8 p.m. Loera was declared dead at 8:40 p.m.
Police said on Tuesday that a juvenile is in custody in connection to Loera's death. The juvenile, who has not been identified as of 2:10 p.m. Tuesday, is an acquaintance of Loera.
"If it's accidental or not- we don't know at this time," Lt. Justin Newsome said. "Even if it is recklessly discharging a firearm and causing the death of another person, it's still manslaughter."
The homeowners who spoke with KVUE said the officers told them that they found a suspected burglar shot dead inside the home. The homeowners were reportedly not at home when the reported burglary happened. They received a phone call from police notifying them about the incident.
Meanwhile, one neighbor said he has seen more crime in the area recently.
"We're trying to improve the security at home and I mean, I don't know what else to do. I try to protect my family. That is the most important thing for me and myself as well," said Jorge Ramirez-Sosa.
Anyone with information regarding the incident is asked to call the homicide tip line at 512-477-3588 or Crime Stoppers at 512-472-TIPS. Tipsters can also text the message plus "Tip 103" to CRIMES.
